cln_elements.content: Fig. 1 Coordination environments of 1–H22O·DMF (a) and 1 (P4322) (b). For clarity, all hydrogen atoms are omitted and the coordinated water O atom (O1W) is shown in yellow. The lowercase letters at the end of the atom labels represent symmetry transformations. Symmetry codes: a = 2 − x, y, 1 − z; b = 1 − y, x, −0.25 + z; c = 1 + y, x, 1.25 − z; d = x, 1 + y, z; e = x, 1 − y, 1.5 − z; f = y, x, 1.25 − z; g = y, 2 − x, 0.25 + z.

cln_elements.content: Fig. 2 Perspective view of the 3D frameworks of 1–H22O·DMF (a) and 1 (b) in space-filling mode along the c-axis. The Van der Waals radii used for Gd, C, H and O atoms are 2.59, 1.7, 1.2 and 1.52 Å, respectively. Color codes follow those of Fig. 1.

Symmetry codes: a = 2 − x, y, −z; b = y, 1 − x, −0.25 + z; c = 2 − y, 1 − x, 0.25 − z; d = x, −1 + y, z; e = x, 1 − y, 0.5 − z; f = 1 − y, 1 − x, 0.25 − z; g = 1 − y, −1 + x, 0.25 + z; h = y, 1 − x, −0.25 + z; i = 2 − y, −1 + x, 0.25 + z; j = x, −1 + y, z; k = 2 − x, 1 − y, 0.5 + z; l = 1 − y, −1 + x, 0.25 + z.

metadata.title: Crystallographic studies into the role of exposed rare earth metal ion for guest sorption
